name: AWS S3 buckets with configurations set to host websites
description: This policy identifies AWS S3 buckets that are configured to host websites. To host a website on AWS S3 you should configure a bucket as a website. By frequently surveying these S3 buckets, you can ensure that only authorized buckets are enabled to host websites. Make sure to disable static website hosting for unauthorized S3 buckets.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-s3api-get-bucket-acl' AND json.rule =  'websiteConfiguration exists'
recommendation:
1. Login to AWS Console
2. Goto S3 under Services
3. Choose the reported bucket
4. Goto Properties tab
5. Click on Static website hosting
6. Click on Disable website hosting
7. Click on Save
compliance.standard: RBI Baseline Cyber Security and Resilience Requirements
